alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 2:55PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Navajo County through 330 PM MST... At 255 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles south of Joseph City, or 29 miles southeast of Winslow, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dry Lake. This includes the following highways... State Route 377 between mile markers 13 and 30. State Route 77 between mile markers 365 and 383. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County
